      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by etern...@gmail.com (Jun 17, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>It could be multiple bugs, different pocs print different asan, including a uaf and a stack-use-after-return.<span class="line"><!---->It could be multiple bugs, different pocs print different asan, including a uaf and a stack-use-after-return.<!----></span><br>But they are in the same webui, so I merged them to a report to you.<span class="line"><!---->But they are in the same webui, so I merged them to a report to you.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: [stable, beta, or dev]<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: [stable, beta, or dev]<!----></span><br>Operating System: Chrome<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Chrome<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Download asan-linux-release-1015312 in <span class="line"><!---->1. Download asan-linux-release-1015312 in <!----></span>https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-asan/o/linux-release-chromeos%2Fasan-linux-release-1015312.zip?generation=1655469268278292&alt=media<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-asan/o/linux-release-chromeos%2Fasan-linux-release-1015312.zip?generation=1655469268278292&amp;alt=media"><!---->https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-asan/o/linux-release-chromeos%2Fasan-linux-release-1015312.zip?generation=1655469268278292&amp;alt=media<!----></a><br><br>2. run: `out/chromeos/chrome --use-system-clipboard --user-data-dir=./chromeos_vm2`<span class="line"><!---->2. run: `out/chromeos/chrome --use-system-clipboard --user-data-dir=./chromeos_vm2`<!----></span><br>[1] poc1(uaf)<span class="line"><!---->[1] poc1(uaf)<!----></span><br>browsing `chrome://oobe` and open devtools<span class="line"><!---->browsing `chrome://oobe` and open devtools<!----></span><br>execute `chrome.send("startDemoModeSetupForTesting", ["tBaEkeIfZaCQqibVZbXyRgrGurDVTuPbIKYNfLpaRjwJXYkMdNgRFZTGEERffXdgCsldNZzvlPOniGVmReBPbXyKNQQh", false, [], false, 4.0]);` in console.<span class="line"><!---->execute `chrome.send("startDemoModeSetupForTesting", class="line"><!---->[2] poc2(stack use after return)<!----></span><br>browsing `chrome://oobe` and open devtools<span class="line"><!---->browsing `chrome://oobe` and open devtools<!----></span><br>execute `chrome.send("updateOobeUIState", ["tBaEkeIfZaCQqibVZbXyRgrGurDVTuPbIKYNfLpaRjwJXYkMdNgRFZTGEERffXdgCsldNZzvlPOniGVmReBPbXyKNQQh", false, [], false, 4.0]);` in           Comment 6<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1337304#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden="">schedule</i>

        > Renato, it seems we create oobe webui in the session too?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Renato, it seems we create oobe webui in the session too?<!----></span><br>I don't think that the WebUI is being created in session automatically. The reporter had to navigate to 'chrome://oobe' in order to trigger the WebUI creation.<span class="line"><!---->I don't think that the WebUI is being created in session automatically. The reporter had to navigate to 'chrome://oobe' in order to trigger the WebUI creation.<!----></span><br><br>Roman, could we restrict the 'chrome://oobe' URL so that it is not possible to call it from the browser directly?<span class="line"><!---->Roman, could we restrict the 'chrome://oobe' URL so that it is not possible to call it from the browser directly?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        osamafathy: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<span class="line"><!---->osamafathy: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<!----></span><br><br>If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<span class="line"><!---->If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<!----></span><br><br>If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug. If you've started working on a fix, please set the status to Started.<span class="line"><!---->If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug. If you've started working on a fix, please set the status to Started.<!----></span><br><br>Thanks for your time! To disable nags, add the Disable-Nags label.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for your time! To disable nags, add the Disable-Nags label.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }

            flex-direction: column;

            width: 100%;

            border: 0;

            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue details<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->prev/next issue in list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->u<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up to issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->r<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->reply to current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->⌘+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-keystrokes></mr-keystrokes>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>It could be multiple bugs, different pocs print different asan, including a uaf and a stack-use-after-return.<span class="line"><!---->It could be multiple bugs, different pocs print different asan, including a uaf and a stack-use-after-return.<!----></span><br>But they are in the same webui, so I merged them to a report to you.<span class="line"><!---->But they are in the same webui, so I merged them to a report to you.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: [stable, beta, or dev]<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: [stable, beta, or dev]<!----></span><br>Operating System: Chrome<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Chrome<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Download asan-linux-release-1015312 in <span class="line"><!---->1. Download asan-linux-release-1015312 in <!----></span>https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-asan/o/linux-release-chromeos%2Fasan-linux-release-1015312.zip?generation=1655469268278292&alt=media<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-asan/o/linux-release-chromeos%2Fasan-linux-release-1015312.zip?generation=1655469268278292&amp;alt=media"><!---->https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-asan/o/linux-release-chromeos%2Fasan-linux-release-1015312.zip?generation=1655469268278292&amp;alt=media<!----></a><br><br>2. run: `out/chromeos/chrome --use-system-clipboard --user-data-dir=./chromeos_vm2`<span class="line"><!---->2. run: `out/chromeos/chrome --use-system-clipboard --user-data-dir=./chromeos_vm2`<!----></span><br>[1] poc1(uaf)<span class="line"><!---->[1] poc1(uaf)<!----></span><br>browsing `chrome://oobe` and open devtools<span class="line"><!---->browsing `chrome://oobe` and open devtools<!----></span><br>execute `chrome.send("startDemoModeSetupForTesting", ["tBaEkeIfZaCQqibVZbXyRgrGurDVTuPbIKYNfLpaRjwJXYkMdNgRFZTGEERffXdgCsldNZzvlPOniGVmReBPbXyKNQQh", false, [], false, 4.0]);` in console.<span class="line"><!---->execute `chrome.send("startDemoModeSetupForTesting", ["tBaEkeIfZaCQqibVZbXyRgrGurDVTuPbIKYNfLpaRjwJXYkMdNgRFZTGEERffXdgCsldNZzvlPOniGVmReBPbXyKNQQh", false, [], false, 4.0]);` in console.<!----></span><br><br>[2] poc2(stack use after return)<span class="line"><!---->[2] poc2(stack use after return)<!----></span><br>browsing `chrome://oobe` and open devtools<span class="line"><!---->browsing `chrome://oobe` and open devtools<!----></span><br>execute `chrome.send("updateOobeUIState", ["tBaEkeIfZaCQqibVZbXyRgrGurDVTuPbIKYNfLpaRjwJXYkMdNgRFZTGEERffXdgCsldNZzvlPOniGVmReBPbXyKNQQh", false, [], false, 4.0]);` in console.<span class="line"><!---->execute `chrome.send("updateOobeUIState", ["tBaEkeIfZaCQqibVZbXyRgrGurDVTuPbIKYNfLpaRjwJXYkMdNgRFZTGEERffXdgCsldNZzvlPOniGVmReBPbXyKNQQh", false, [], false, 4.0]);` in console.<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL         LTS Milestone M102<span class="line"><!---->LTS Milestone M102<!----></span><br><br>This issue has been flagged as a merge candidate for Chrome OS' LTS channel. If selected, our merge team will handle any additional merges. To help us determine if this issue requires a merge to LTS, please answer this short questionnaire:<span class="line"><!---->This issue has been flagged as a merge candidate for Chrome OS' LTS channel. If selected, our merge team will handle any additional merges. To help us determine if this issue requires a merge to LTS, please answer this short questionnaire:<!----></span><br>1. Was this issue a regression for the milestone it was found in?<span class="line"><!---->1. Was this issue a regression for the milestone it was found in?<!----></span><br>2. Is this issue related to a change or feature merged after the latest LTS Milestone?<span class="line"><!---->2. Is this issue related to a change or feature merged after the latest LTS Milestone?<!----></span><br><br><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.             Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;

          color: var(--chops-link-color);

          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

          <input type="text" name="newHotlistName">
        </div>
        
      <br>
      
    
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button class="de-emphasized discard-button">
            Discard
          </chops-button>
          <chops-button class="emphasized">
            Save changes
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </form>
    
    </chops-dialog>
    <mr-update-issue-hotlists-dialog id="update-issue-hotlists"></mr-update-issue-hotlists-dialog>

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>It could be multiple bugs, different pocs print different asan, including a uaf and a stack-use-after-return.<span class="line"><!---->It could be multiple bugs, different pocs print different asan, including a uaf and a stack-use-after-return.<!----></span><br>But they are in the same webui, so I merged them to a report to you.<span class="line"><!---->But they are in the same webui, so I merged them to a report to you.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: [stable, beta, or dev]<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: [stable, beta, or dev]<!----></span><br>Operating System: Chrome<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Chrome<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Download asan-linux-release-1015312 in <span class="line"><!---->1. Download asan-linux-release-1015312 in <!----></span>https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-asan/o/linux-release-chromeos%2Fasan-linux-release-1015312.zip?generation=1655469268278292&alt=media<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-asan/o/linux-release-chromeos%2Fasan-linux-release-1015312.zip?generation=1655469268278292&amp;alt=media"><!---->https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-asan/o/linux-release-chromeos%2Fasan-linux-release-1015312.zip?generation=1655469268278292&amp;alt=media<!----></a><br><br>2. run: `out/chromeos/chrome --use-system-clipboard --user-data-dir=./chromeos_vm2`<span class="line"><!---->2. run: `out/chromeos/chrome --use-system-clipboard --user-data-dir=./chromeos_vm2`<!----></span><br>[1] poc1(uaf)<span class="line"><!---->[1] poc1(uaf)<!----></span><br>browsing `chrome://oobe` and open devtools<span class="line"><!---->browsing `chrome://oobe` and open devtools<!----></span><br>execute `chrome.send("startDemoModeSetupForTesting", ["tBaEkeIfZaCQqibVZbXyRgrGurDVTuPbIKYNfLpaRjwJXYkMdNgRFZTGEERffXdgCsldNZzvlPOniGVmReBPbXyKNQQh", false, [], false, 4.0]);` in console.<span class="line"><!---->execute `chrome.send("startDemoModeSetupForTesting", ["tBaEkeIfZaCQqibVZbXyRgrGurDVTuPbIKYNfLpaRjwJXYkMdNgRFZTGEERffXdgCsldNZzvlPOniGVmReBPbXyKNQQh", false, [], false, 4.0]);` in console.<!----></span><br><br>[2] poc2(stack use after return)<span class="line"><!---->[2] poc2(stack use after return)<!----></span><br>browsing `chrome://oobe` and open devtools<span class="line"><!---->browsing `chrome://oobe` and open devtools<!----></span><br>execute `chrome.send("updateOobeUIState", ["tBaEkeIfZaCQqibVZbXyRgrGurDVTuPbIKYNfLpaRjwJXYkMdNgRFZTGEERffXdgCsldNZzvlPOniGVmReBPbXyKNQQh", false, [], false, 4.0]);` in console.<span class="line"><!---->execute `chrome.send("updateOobeUIState", ["tBaEkeIfZaCQqibVZbXyRgrGurDVTuPbIKYNfLpaRjwJXYkMdNgRFZTGEERffXdgCsldNZzvlPOniGVmReBPbXyKNQQh", false, [], false, 4.0]);` in console.<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see asan file<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see asan file<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Nan Wang(@eternalsakura13) and Guang Gong of 360 Vulnerability Research         re: <span class="line"><!---->re: <!----></span>#c6<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c6"><!---->#c6<!----></a><br>hi, In fact this dcheck trigger might help you. This is apparently an unexpected multiple initialization happening.<span class="line"><!---->hi, In fact this dcheck trigger might help you. This is apparently an unexpected multiple initialization happening.<!----></span><br>This also proves that this vulnerability may have other paths that are easier to trigger :)<span class="line"><!---->This also proves that this vulnerability may have other paths that are easier to trigger :)<!----></span><br>````<span class="line"><!---->````<!----></span><br>  void AddObserver(ObserverType* obs) {<span class="line"><!---->  void AddObserver(ObserverType* obs) {<!----></span><br>    DCHECK(obs);<span class="line"><!---->    DCHECK(obs);<!----></span><br>    if (HasObserver(obs)) {<span class="line"><!---->    if (HasObserver(obs)) {<!----></span><br>      NOTREACHED() << "Observers can only be added once!"; //---->debug check trigger!!!<span observers_.emplace_back(ObserverStorageType(obs));<span class="line"><!---->    observers_.emplace_back(ObserverStorageType(obs));<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>- reproduce<span class="line"><!---->- reproduce<!----></span><br>open `chrome://oobe`, wait for a while, refresh several times<span class="line"><!---->open `chrome://oobe`, wait for a while, refresh several times<!----></span><br><br>- Apply patch to dump stack log<span class="line"><!---->- Apply patch to dump stack log<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>diff --git a/base/observer_list.h b/base/observer_list.h<span class="line"><!---->diff --git a/base/observer_list.h class="line"><!---->--- a/base/observer_list.h<!----></span><br>+++ b/base/observer_list.h<span class="line"><!---->+++ b/base/observer_list.h<!----></span><br>@@ -273,6 +273,7 @@ class ObserverList {<span class="line"><!---->@@ -273,6 +273,7 @@ class ObserverList {<!----></span><br>     DCHECK(obs);<span class="line"><!---->     DCHECK(obs);<!----></span><br>     if (HasObserver(obs)) {<span be added once!";<!----></span><br>+      CHECK(false);<span class="line"><!---->+      CHECK(false);<!----></span><br>       return;<span class="line"><!---->       return;<!----></span><br>         Sorry, I don't think I have cycles to fix the tests, but looking at _api_features.json all the following WebUIs support WebViews:<span class="line"><!---->Sorry, I don't think I have cycles to fix the tests, but looking at _api_features.json all the following WebUIs support WebViews:<!----></span><br>      "chrome://assistant-optin/*",<span class="line"><!---->      "chrome://assistant-optin/*",<!----></span><br>      "chrome://add-supervision/*",<span class="line"><!---->      "chrome://add-supervision/*",<!----></span><br>      "chrome://chrome-signin/*",<span class="line"><!---->      "chrome://chrome-signin/*",<!----></span><br>      "chrome://discards/*",<span class="line"><!---->      "chrome://discards/*",<!----></span><br>      "chrome://mobilesetup/*",<span class="line"><!---->      "chrome://mobilesetup/*",<!----></span><br>      "chrome://oobe/*",<span class="line"><!---->      "chrome://oobe/*",<!----></span><br>      "chrome://os-settings/*",<span class="line"><!---->      "chrome://os-settings/*",<!----></span><br>      "chrome://parent-access/*",<span class="line"><!---->      "chrome://parent-access/*",<!----></span><br>      "chrome://password-change/*",<span class="line"><!---->      "chrome://password-change/*",<!----></span><br>      "chrome://lock-reauth/*"<span class="line"><!---->      "chrome://lock-reauth/*"<!----></span><br><br>You could try changing the URL in those tests to one of the above and see if the tests work.<span class="line"><!---->You could try changing the URL in those tests to one of the above and see if the tests work.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This issue requires additional review before it can be merged to the LTS channel. Please answer the following questions to help us evaluate this merge:<span class="line"><!---->This issue requires additional review before it can be merged to the LTS channel. Please answer the following questions to help us evaluate this merge:<!----></span><br><br>1. Number of CLs needed for this fix and links to them.<span class="line"><!---->1.           flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>
      
      
    <!----></mr-launch-overview>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

        mr-issue-page {

          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;

          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);

          overflow-y: auto;

            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>


      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>It could be multiple bugs, different pocs print different asan, including a uaf and a stack-use-after-return.<span class="line"><!---->It could be multiple bugs, different pocs print different asan, including a uaf and a stack-use-after-return.<!----></span><br>But they are in the same webui, so I merged them to a report to you.<span class="line"><!---->But they are in the same webui, so I merged them to a report to you.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: [stable, beta, or dev]<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: [stable, beta, or dev]<!----></span><br>Operating System: Chrome<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Chrome<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Download asan-linux-release-1015312 in <span class="line"><!---->1. Download asan-linux-release-1015312 in <!----></span>https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-asan/o/linux-release-chromeos%2Fasan-linux-release-1015312.zip?generation=1655469268278292&alt=media<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-asan/o/linux-release-chromeos%2Fasan-linux-release-1015312.zip?generation=1655469268278292&amp;alt=media"><!---->https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-asan/o/linux-release-chromeos%2Fasan-linux-release-1015312.zip?generation=1655469268278292&amp;alt=media<!----></a><br><br>2. run: `out/chromeos/chrome --use-system-clipboard --user-data-dir=./chromeos_vm2`<span class="line"><!---->2. run: `out/chromeos/chrome --use-system-clipboard --user-data-dir=./chromeos_vm2`<!----></span><br>[1] poc1(uaf)<span class="line"><!---->[1] poc1(uaf)<!----></span><br>browsing `chrome://oobe` and open devtools<span class="line"><!---->browsing `chrome://oobe` and open devtools<!----></span><br>execute `chrome.send("startDemoModeSetupForTesting", ["tBaEkeIfZaCQqibVZbXyRgrGurDVTuPbIKYNfLpaRjwJXYkMdNgRFZTGEERffXdgCsldNZzvlPOniGVmReBPbXyKNQQh", false, [], false, 4.0]);` in console.<span class="line"><!---->execute `chrome.send("startDemoModeSetupForTesting", ["tBaEkeIfZaCQqibVZbXyRgrGurDVTuPbIKYNfLpaRjwJXYkMdNgRFZTGEERffXdgCsldNZzvlPOniGVmReBPbXyKNQQh", false, [], false, 4.0]);` in console.<!----></span><br><br>[2] poc2(stack use after return)<span class="line"><!---->[2] poc2(stack use after return)<!----></span><br>browsing `chrome://oobe` and open devtools<span class="line"><!---->browsing `chrome://oobe` and open devtools<!----></span><br>execute `chrome.send("updateOobeUIState", ["tBaEkeIfZaCQqibVZbXyRgrGurDVTuPbIKYNfLpaRjwJXYkMdNgRFZTGEERffXdgCsldNZzvlPOniGVmReBPbXyKNQQh", false, [], false, 4.0]);` in console.<span class="line"><!---->execute `chrome.send("updateOobeUIState", ["tBaEkeIfZaCQqibVZbXyRgrGurDVTuPbIKYNfLpaRjwJXYkMdNgRFZTGEERffXdgCsldNZzvlPOniGVmReBPbXyKNQQh", false, [], false, 4.0]);` in console.<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see asan file<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see asan file<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Nan Wang(@eternalsakura13) and Guang Gong of 360 Vulnerability Research         Sorry, I don't think I have cycles to fix the tests, but looking at _api_features.json all the following WebUIs support WebViews:<span class="line"><!---->Sorry, I don't think I have cycles to fix the tests, but looking at _api_features.json all the following WebUIs support WebViews:<!----></span><br>      "chrome://assistant-optin/*",<span class="line"><!---->      "chrome://assistant-optin/*",<!----></span><br>      "chrome://add-supervision/*",<span class="line"><!---->      "chrome://add-supervision/*",<!----></span><br>      "chrome://chrome-signin/*",<span class="line"><!---->      "chrome://chrome-signin/*",<!----></span><br>      "chrome://discards/*",<span class="line"><!---->      "chrome://discards/*",<!----></span><br>      "chrome://mobilesetup/*",<span class="line"><!---->      "chrome://mobilesetup/*",<!----></span><br>      "chrome://oobe/*",<span class="line"><!---->      "chrome://oobe/*",<!----></span><br>      "chrome://os-settings/*",<span class="line"><!---->      "chrome://os-settings/*",<!----></span><br>      "chrome://parent-access/*",<span class="line"><!---->      "chrome://parent-access/*",<!----></span><br>      "chrome://password-change/*",<span class="line"><!---->      "chrome://password-change/*",<!----></span><br>      "chrome://lock-reauth/*"<span class="line"><!---->      "chrome://lock-reauth/*"<!----></span><br><br>You could try changing the URL in those tests to one of the above and see if the tests work.<span class="line"><!---->You could try changing the URL in those tests to one of the above and see if the tests work.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        osamafathy: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<span class="line"><!---->osamafathy: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<!----></span><br><br>If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<span class="line"><!---->If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<!----></span><br><br>If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         mr-launch-overview {

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>It could be multiple bugs, different pocs print different asan, including a uaf and a stack-use-after-return.<span class="line"><!---->It could be multiple bugs, different pocs print different asan, including a uaf and a stack-use-after-return.<!----></span><br>But they are in the same webui, so I merged them to a report to you.<span class="line"><!---->But they are in the same webui, so I merged them to a report to you.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: [stable, beta, or dev]<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: [stable, beta, or dev]<!----></span><br>Operating System: Chrome<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Chrome<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Download asan-linux-release-1015312 in <span class="line"><!---->1. Download asan-linux-release-1015312 in <!----></span>https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-asan/o/linux-release-chromeos%2Fasan-linux-release-1015312.zip?generation=1655469268278292&alt=media<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-asan/o/linux-release-chromeos%2Fasan-linux-release-1015312.zip?generation=1655469268278292&amp;alt=media"><!---->https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/chromium-browser-asan/o/linux-release-chromeos%2Fasan-linux-release-1015312.zip?generation=1655469268278292&amp;alt=media<!----></a><br><br>2. run: `out/chromeos/chrome --use-system-clipboard --user-data-dir=./chromeos_vm2`<span class="line"><!---->2. run: `out/chromeos/chrome --use-system-clipboard --user-data-dir=./chromeos_vm2`<!----></span><br>[1] poc1(uaf)<span class="line"><!---->[1] poc1(uaf)<!----></span><br>browsing `chrome://oobe` and open devtools<span class="line"><!---->browsing `chrome://oobe` and open devtools<!----></span><br>execute `chrome.send("startDemoModeSetupForTesting", ["tBaEkeIfZaCQqibVZbXyRgrGurDVTuPbIKYNfLpaRjwJXYkMdNgRFZTGEERffXdgCsldNZzvlPOniGVmReBPbXyKNQQh", false, [], false, 4.0]);` in console.<span class="line"><!---->execute `chrome.send("startDemoModeSetupForTesting", ["tBaEkeIfZaCQqibVZbXyRgrGurDVTuPbIKYNfLpaRjwJXYkMdNgRFZTGEERffXdgCsldNZzvlPOniGVmReBPbXyKNQQh", false, [], false, 4.0]);` in console.<!----></span><br><br>[2] poc2(stack use after return)<span class="line"><!---->[2] poc2(stack use after return)<!----></span><br>browsing `chrome://oobe` and open devtools<span class="line"><!---->browsing `chrome://oobe` and open devtools<!----></span><br>execute `chrome.send("updateOobeUIState", ["tBaEkeIfZaCQqibVZbXyRgrGurDVTuPbIKYNfLpaRjwJXYkMdNgRFZTGEERffXdgCsldNZzvlPOniGVmReBPbXyKNQQh", false, [], false, 4.0]);` in console.<span class="line"><!---->execute `chrome.send("updateOobeUIState", ["tBaEkeIfZaCQqibVZbXyRgrGurDVTuPbIKYNfLpaRjwJXYkMdNgRFZTGEERffXdgCsldNZzvlPOniGVmReBPbXyKNQQh", false, [], false, 4.0]);` in console.<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL
